Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2015 09:52AM - edited Jan 17, 2015 10:00AM by surprisedat65 "but some breast lesions do have "characteristics" that suggest cancer. The surgeon's opinion may be based on that, combined with his experience." Yes, this is the type of information I was wondering about.  "Perhaps the surgeon is concerned that because you are so very optimistic that the findings are going to be benign, that if indeed, a malignancy is found, you will find it especially difficult to absorb and to be able to cope. So even though he was a bit abrupt, he has planted a seed in your mind, that you might indeed have BC." This also crossed my mind.
Posts.Title: What the surgeon told me on my first visit surprisedat65 farmerjo

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2015 08:33PM surprisedat65 wrote: Thanks to all for your helpful replies. I believe I have found a good place to "talk" about this new wrinkle in my life.
Posts.Title: What the surgeon told me on my first visit surprisedat65 farmerjo

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2015 10:54AM surprisedat65 wrote: In reading this board's info on dealing with one's records I suddenly remembered that I had been given a little packet, still in my purse, of CDs and the radiology reports. Both of the most recent radiology reports, the mammo and the ultrasound, unfortunately say "mass with malignant characteristics, "Assessment category 5," BI-RADS category 5: highly suggestive of malignancy." Had I not asked the question of the doctor about what would happen in the future if the biopsy were normal I would have gone home still thinking blues skies ahead.
Posts.Title: What the surgeon told me on my first visit surprisedat65 farmerjo

Posts.Content: Nov 17, 2015 10:58PM surprisedat65 wrote: I'm a little past the midpoint of my course of treatment (14 left). Have been very fortunate so far—doc seems surprised that I have had no skin disturbance or discomfort . I bought an aloe plant and have used the aloe every day before I go for treatment. Last week they gave me a tube of Aquaphor which I'm to use at bedtime. So I guess I'm fortunate, tho' not expecting to escape completely unscathed. I missed an early November appt. with my medical oncologist (chemo brain I guess—must not have written it into my appt. book) who I won't see till next week. My main complaint has to do with my post chemo condition—still have little taste ability, and despite a course and then doubling of gabapentin my neuropathy in fingers and toes continues. The tastebud thing has enabled me to lose another 5 lbs.—that's a total of 25 lbs. well gone. Don't know whether I actually want the taste problem resolved or not, 'cause I could easily use to lose another 20! But it does make it hard for my husband as I have very little enthusiasm for planning or cooking dinner. So, no complaints yet about rads.
Posts.Title: Fall 2015 Rads queenmomcat HappyHammer

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2015 09:13AM surprisedat65 wrote: Can anyone tell me if there's a big difference between surgical scrub caps and do-rags? There sure is a big difference in price. I recall seeing nurses in scrub caps when I had my lumpectomy and thought they were cute, but I don't know that I want to pay $18 for one (from Amazon).
Posts.Title: More Tips (and a Shopping List) for Getting Through Chemo rock MinusTwo

Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2015 11:07PM - edited Feb 4, 2015 11:09PM by surprisedat65 Thanks, all. I'm just beginning to settle in to the idea that my condition is not going to be as cut and dried as I had imagined. Now all I want to do is get on with it. I am now holding my breath regarding the results of the MRI which I'm having today (Thu). Come to think of it, I guess holding my breath is good practice for that test.
Posts.Title: Finally got my path report—need a little help surprisedat65 surprisedat65

Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2015 09:22AM surprisedat65 wrote: Copperlisa, my MRI was a relative breeze, and whether that's due to my body or the expertise of the practice I'll never know (I hope, meaning I hope I won't need another in the future). I only had to stay in position for 20 minutes, they let me know when halftime was, and I got to listen to music I liked, altho' I should have asked it to be made LOUDER!
Posts.Title: Finally got my path report—need a little help surprisedat65 surprisedat65
